column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/36e826cea14585f68d5c363a82c1a887a779e130 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

I am seeing a different assertion failure during bitcoind "stop" both before and after this patch.

/usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/recursive_mutex.hpp:105: void boost::recursive_mutex::lock(): Assertion `!pthread_mutex_lock(&m)' failed.

I am able to reproduce this easily with my native build on Fedora 18 x86_64 with boost-1.50.0-5.fc18.x86_64, but after 20 attempts it didn't seem to happen
